{"step_by_step_thinking": "To answer this question, we need to understand what universal coverage means. Universal health coverage means that all people and communities can use the promotive, preventive, curative, rehabilitative and palliative health services they need, of sufficient quality to be effective, while also ensuring that the use of these services does not expose the user to financial hardship. Now, considering Kenya, while the country has made strides towards universal health coverage, it is not fully there yet. There are still issues with access to healthcare, especially in rural areas, and the quality of healthcare can vary. Additionally, out-of-pocket expenses for healthcare are still high for many Kenyans, which can lead to financial hardship.", "answer_choice": "B. no"}
